newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Petron two-month market share slips.
newsitem.headline: Petron two-month market share slips.

text.p: The market share of oil refiner Petron Corp slipped to 42.4 percent in the first two months of this year, against 42.7 percent in the same period last year, data from the Department of Energy released on Tuesday showed.
Petron's sales were 3.5 percent lower than last year. Sales of the industry fell by 2.8 percent during the period.
Petron sold 8.6 million barrels of finished oil products as of February, down from 8.9 million barrels sold in the same period last year.
The market share of Pilipinas Shell Petroleum Corp, a unit of Royal Dutch Shell Group, declined to 32.4 percent from last year's 34.1 percent.
Caltex (Philippines) Inc, a joint venture between Chevron Corp and Texaco Inc, benefited with its share rising to 24.8 percent from 23.1 percent last year.
